title: forge feat: add `serde::Serialize` and `serde::Deserialize` traits upon abigen
body:
### Component

Forge

### Describe the feature you would like

When generating contract bindings via `forge bind`, it would be excellent if the structs/enums created can implement `serde::{Serialize, Deserialize}` so that users may ultimately be able to output data collected from such calls/events/errors into other formats such as CSV or databases. 

Note that I also linked an issue in [`ethers-rs` here](https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/issues/2599). However, I think this is not necessary as I have a quick addition to Forge that solves the problem and can be made more configurable.

See here:
https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/blob/ae89c92ee32b38d525429fe9c216a0919bc7bed1/crates/forge/bin/cmd/bind.rs#L122-L145

If we replace the `.map` on line 134 as such:

```rust
.map(|x| {
                Abigen::from_file(x)?
                    .add_derive("serde::Serialize")?
                    .add_derive("serde::Deserialize")
            })
```
then we find the additional traits are derived on the relevant structs/enums.

I am happy to implement these changes in a PR. Please see the additional context for more configurability.

### Additional context

The feature could also include a flag in a few ways, if we want more configuration. E.g.,
- `forge bind --with-serde` adds the addition to the map as shown, and otherwise leaves it as is.
- `forge bind --with-derive "serde::Serialize" --with-derive "serde::Deserialize"` adds each derive one by one. Could also allow for multiple strings as:
- `forge bind --with-derives ["serde::Serialize", "serde::Deserialize"]`
